parameters.name: format
parameters.description: the format for the volume. Possible values include QCOW2, OVA, and VHD.

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: the name of the volume

parameters.name: url
parameters.description: the URL of where the volume is hosted. Possible URL include http:// and https://

parameters.name: zoneid
parameters.description: the ID of the zone the volume is to be hosted on

parameters.name: domainid
parameters.description: an optional domainId. If the account parameter is used, domainId must also be used. If account is NOT provided then volume will be assigned to the caller account and domain.

parameters.name: account
parameters.description: an optional accountName. Must be used with domainId.

parameters.name: checksum
parameters.description:
the checksum value of this volume. The parameter containing the checksum will be considered a MD5sum if it is not prefixed
 and just a plain ascii/utf8 representation of a hexadecimal string. If it is required to
 use another algorithm the hexadecimal string is to be prefixed with a string of the form,
 "{<algorithm>}", not including the double quotes. In this <algorithm> is the exact string
 representing the java supported algorithm, i.e. MD5 or SHA-256. Note that java does not
 contain an algorithm called SHA256 or one called sha-256, only SHA-256.

parameters.name: imagestoreuuid
parameters.description: Image store uuid

parameters.name: projectid
parameters.description: Upload volume for the project

parameters.name: diskofferingid
parameters.description: the ID of the disk offering. This must be a custom sized offering since during uploadVolume volume size is unknown.

commands.description: Lists unmanaged volumes on a storage pool

parameters.name: storageid
parameters.description: the ID of the storage pool

parameters.name: path
parameters.description: the path of the volume on the storage pool

parameters.name: keyword
parameters.description: List by keyword

parameters.description: The ID of the volume

parameters.name: expunge
parameters.description: If true is passed, the volume is expunged immediately. False by default.

commands.description: Unmanage a volume on storage pool.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The ID of the volume to unmanage

commands.description: Import an unmanaged volume from a storage pool on a host into CloudStack

parameters.name: path
parameters.description: the path of the volume

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: the name of the volume. If not set, it will be set to the path of the volume.

parameters.name: storageid
parameters.description: the ID of the storage pool

parameters.name: diskofferingid
parameters.description: the ID of the disk offering linked to the volume

parameters.name: account
parameters.description: an optional account for the volume. Must be used with domainId.

parameters.name: domainid
parameters.description: import volume to the domain specified

parameters.name: projectid
parameters.description: import volume for the project

parameters.name: hostid
parameters.description: list volumes on specified host

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: the ID of the disk volume

parameters.name: ids
parameters.description: the IDs of the volumes, mutually exclusive with id

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: the name of the disk volume

parameters.name: podid
parameters.description: the pod id the disk volume belongs to

parameters.name: clusterid
parameters.description: the cluster id the disk volume belongs to

parameters.name: type
parameters.description: the type of disk volume

parameters.name: virtualmachineid
parameters.description: the ID of the virtual machine

parameters.name: zoneid
parameters.description: the ID of the availability zone

parameters.name: storageid
parameters.description: the ID of the storage pool, available to ROOT admin only

parameters.name: serviceofferingid
parameters.description: list volumes by disk offering of a service offering. If both service offering and disk offering are passed, service offering is ignored

parameters.name: diskofferingid
parameters.description: list volumes by disk offering

parameters.name: displayvolume
parameters.description: list resources by display flag; only ROOT admin is eligible to pass this parameter

parameters.name: listsystemvms
parameters.description: list system VMs; only ROOT admin is eligible to pass this parameter

parameters.name: state
parameters.description: state of the volume. Possible values are: Ready, Allocated, Destroy, Expunging, Expunged.

parameters.name: isencrypted
parameters.description: list only volumes that are encrypted

parameters.name: retrieveonlyresourcecount
parameters.description: makes the API's response contains only the resource count

parameters.name: tags
parameters.description: List resources by tags (key/value pairs)

parameters.name: projectid
parameters.description: list objects by project; if projectid=-1 lists All VMs

parameters.name: account
parameters.description: list resources by account. Must be used with the domainId parameter.

parameters.name: listall
parameters.description: If set to false, list only resources belonging to the command's caller; if set to true - list resources that the caller is authorized to see. Default value is false. Resources dedicated to a project are listed only if using the projectid parameter.

parameters.name: domainid
parameters.description: list only resources belonging to the domain specified

parameters.name: isrecursive
parameters.description: defaults to false, but if true, lists all resources from the parent specified by the domainId till leaves.

parameters.name: keyword
parameters.description: List by keyword

parameters.name: volumeid
parameters.description: the ID of the volume

parameters.name: storageid
parameters.description: destination storage pool ID to migrate the volume to

parameters.name: livemigrate
parameters.description: if the volume should be live migrated when it is attached to a running vm

parameters.name: newdiskofferingid
parameters.description: The new disk offering ID that replaces the current one used by the volume. This new disk offering is used to better reflect the new storage where the volume is going to be migrated to.

commands.description: Creates a disk volume from a disk offering. This disk volume must still be attached to a virtual machine to make use of it.

parameters.name: account
parameters.description: the account associated with the disk volume. Must be used with the domainId parameter.

parameters.name: projectid
parameters.description: the project associated with the volume. Mutually exclusive with account parameter

parameters.name: domainid
parameters.description: the domain ID associated with the disk offering. If used with the account parameter returns the disk volume associated with the account for the specified domain.If account is NOT provided then the volume will be assigned to the caller account and domain.

parameters.name: diskofferingid
parameters.description: the ID of the disk offering. Either diskOfferingId or snapshotId must be passed in.

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: the name of the disk volume

parameters.name: size
parameters.description: Arbitrary volume size

parameters.name: miniops
parameters.description: min iops

parameters.name: maxiops
parameters.description: max iops

parameters.name: snapshotid
parameters.description: the snapshot ID for the disk volume. Either diskOfferingId or snapshotId must be passed in.

parameters.name: zoneid
parameters.description: the ID of the availability zone

parameters.name: displayvolume
parameters.description: an optional field, whether to display the volume to the end user or not.

parameters.name: virtualmachineid
parameters.description: the ID of the virtual machine; to be used with snapshot Id, VM to which the volume gets attached after creation

parameters.name: customid
parameters.description: an optional field, in case you want to set a custom id to the resource. Allowed to Root Admins only

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The ID of the volume

commands.description: Attaches a disk volume to a virtual machine.

parameters.name: deviceid
parameters.description:
The ID of the device to map the volume to the guest OS. If no deviceID is informed, the next available deviceID will be chosen. Use 0 when volume needs to be attached as ROOT.
When using a linux operating system and the hypervisor XenServer, the devices IDs will be mapped as follows:
  • 0 maps to /dev/xvda;
  • 1 maps to /dev/xvdb;
  • 2 maps /dev/xvdc and so on.
Please refer to the docs of your hypervisor for the correct mapping of the deviceID and the actual logical disk structure.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: the ID of the disk volume

parameters.name: virtualmachineid
parameters.description: the ID of the virtual machine

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: the ID of the disk volume

parameters.name: path
parameters.description: The path of the volume

parameters.name: chaininfo
parameters.description: The chain info of the volume

parameters.name: storageid
parameters.description: Destination storage pool UUID for the volume

parameters.name: state
parameters.description: The state of the volume

parameters.name: displayvolume
parameters.description: an optional field, whether to the display the volume to the end user or not.

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: new name of the volume

parameters.name: deleteprotection
parameters.description: Set delete protection for the volume. If true, The volume will be protected from deletion. Note: If the volume is managed by another service like autoscaling groups or CKS, delete protection will be ignored.

parameters.name: customid
parameters.description: an optional field, in case you want to set a custom id to the resource. Allowed to Root Admins only

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: the ID of the disk volume

parameters.name: miniops
parameters.description: New minimum number of IOPS

parameters.name: maxiops
parameters.description: New maximum number of IOPS

parameters.name: size
parameters.description: New volume size in GB

parameters.name: shrinkok
parameters.description: Verify OK to Shrink

parameters.name: diskofferingid
parameters.description: new disk offering id

parameters.name: automigrate
parameters.description: Flag to allow automatic migration of the volume to another suitable storage pool that accommodates the new size

the checksum value of this volume. The parameter containing the checksum will be considered a MD5sum if it is not prefixed

 "{<algorithm>}", not including the double quotes. In this <algorithm> is the exact string

commands.description: Upload a data disk to the cloudstack cloud.

parameters.name: imagestoreuuid
parameters.description: Image store uuid

parameters.name: diskofferingid
parameters.description: the ID of the disk offering. This must be a custom sized offering since during upload of volume/template size is unknown.

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: the name of the volume/template/iso

parameters.name: format
parameters.description: the format for the volume/template/iso. Possible values include QCOW2, OVA, and VHD.

parameters.name: zoneid
parameters.description: the ID of the zone the volume/template/iso is to be hosted on

parameters.name: checksum
parameters.description:
the checksum value of this volume/template/iso The parameter containing the checksum will be considered a MD5sum if it is not prefixed
 and just a plain ascii/utf8 representation of a hexadecimal string. If it is required to
 use another algorithm the hexadecimal string is to be prefixed with a string of the form,
 "{<algorithm>}", not including the double quotes. In this <algorithm> is the exact string
 representing the java supported algorithm, i.e. MD5 or SHA-256. Note that java does not
 contain an algorithm called SHA256 or one called sha-256, only SHA-256.

parameters.name: account
parameters.description: an optional accountName. Must be used with domainId.

parameters.name: domainid
parameters.description: an optional domainId. If the account parameter is used, domainId must also be used.

parameters.name: projectid
parameters.description: Upload volume/template/iso for the project

commands.description: Change disk offering of the volume and also an option to auto migrate if required to apply the new disk offering

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: the ID of the volume

parameters.name: diskofferingid
parameters.description: new disk offering id

parameters.name: size
parameters.description: New volume size in GB for the custom disk offering

parameters.name: miniops
parameters.description: New minimum number of IOPS for the custom disk offering

parameters.name: maxiops
parameters.description: New maximum number of IOPS for the custom disk offering

parameters.name: automigrate
parameters.description: Flag for automatic migration of the volume with new disk offering whenever migration is required to apply the offering

parameters.name: shrinkok
parameters.description: Verify OK to Shrink

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The ID of the volume

parameters.name: volumeid
parameters.description: the ID of the volume

parameters.name: storageid
parameters.description: destination storage pool ID to migrate the volume to

parameters.name: livemigrate
parameters.description: if the volume should be live migrated when it is attached to a running vm

parameters.name: newdiskofferingid
parameters.description: The new disk offering ID that replaces the current one used by the volume. This new disk offering is used to better reflect the new storage where the volume is going to be migrated to.
